aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm

Class GeoNonTermArgument

  • java.lang.Object
    • aprove.Framework.IntTRS.Nonterm.GeoNonTerm.GeoNonTermArgument

  • public class GeoNonTermArgument
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a Geometric Non-Termination Argument (GNA). It's a artifact generated by the GeoNonTermAnalysis and can be seen as a proof of non-termination. It can test itself against a matrix and constants given to proof it's correctness.
    A GNA is a correct GNA if the following four conditions are met:
    1. domain: x_0,x_1,y_0,...,y_k \in R^n
    2. init: x_0,x_1 \in STEM (trivial as it is derived from that)
    3. point: A*(x_1 x_1+\sum_i y_i) <= b
    4. ray: A*(y_i lambda_i*y_i+mu_(i-1)*y_(i-1)) <= 0
    Author:
    Timo Bergerbusch
    See Also:
    GeoNonTermAnalysis

                        GNAVector b)
        checks the GeoNonTermArgument against an iteration-matrix and iterations-constant
        Parameters:
        a - the iteration-matrix
        b - the iteration-constant

        checks if the 4 criteria's of a GeoNonTermArgument hold.
